subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...

Tell yourself whatever makes you feel better or whatever allows you to slee=
p at night. Also, you may want to research into Tesla a bit more. He did no=
t die poor! He died while living in an upscale hotel (the New Yorker) in NY=
, NY. Immediately after his death, all of his belongings, papers and resear=
ch were confiscated by the US government. The debt's that were attributed t=
o him (and the reason why people thought he was poor) were with the very ma=
n that ruined his reputation, George Westinghouse.

Frank R.

----- Origina=
l Message ----
From: erick hunter <erick_hunter9@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, November 15, 2007 6:29:14 PM
Subject: RE: [EVP=
-ITC] Oh Bruce...










  


    
            
Thank you, Frank!  There=
 you have it!  The last time I checked, the U.S. of A. was a "Capitalist" c=
ountry...! That simply means making or buying wholesale a product that will=
 retail for more money than was invested thus making a Profit.  You want an=
 example?  You just have to look at Thomas Edison and Nickola Tesla.  Both =
were brilliant men,  pioneers in their field,  which was basically the same=
 for both.  One was more brilliant than the other,  in turn the less brilli=
ant "stole" ideas and products from the other.  The most brilliant was not =
a "Capitalist" ,  he devoted his time and efforts to "bettering the lives o=
f mankind".  The lessor was indeed a "Capitalist" ,  his motives were less =
noble,  however,  and he was willing to "better" mankind,  too,  but make a=
 good profit in the process.  We all know the story...one is foremost in th=
e eyes of the general
 public,  became personally rich and famous,  while t=
he other died broke and without fanfare.  A shame,  but factual,  none-the-=
less.  Would you work for free?  Would you supply people with something the=
y want without recompense?  I think not.  I certainly wouldn't!  Get real. =
 Bruce is going to post a capture, he says, from Nickola Tesla.  I predict =
that it will be a warning... "Don't Do What I Did!  Make a Profit!"    --Ro=
d  
   
   
   
   
   
  
Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@ hotmail.com> wrote=
:
       Well...Mean Bitch week was last week, so I was trying to be nice. =
Yeah, I can make a box for like $50 if it's on perf board, and $100 if it o=
n PCB, the bare board alone is about $46. The only problem I have is the ti=
me. It takes two weeks minumum to get a box together and working. Most peop=
le would like to get paid for their time. I make about $40 an hour at my re=
al job. ( been here 24 years!) Someday this stuff will get mass produced in=
 China, and be included in every cell phone!

 
 Frank-S

      To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups .com
From: warrior18eii@ yahoo.com
Date: Thu, 15 Nov 2007 08:5=
4:53 -0800
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...

          I realize the time=
 it takes to put things together. Especially units built from the ground up=
 but if you are taking on the duty of spreading the technology to help mank=
ind, to me it would be a labor of love. I can see and accept recovering pro=
duction costs even, but this guy is looking to make a huge profit. 

You ga=
ined your respect and credibility on the fact that you have a system that w=
orks and you are willing to give it away when you didn't have to Frank. Thi=
s guy is coming out of the gate with a cheap imitation of EVP maker and you=
r system (both of which are free) and putting a huge price tag on it. It ju=
st don't sit right with me!

Honestly, I know it is none of my business wha=
t Ron does but I guess I just needed to register my protest with this
 seem=
ingly blatant attempt at exploiting good though naive people.

Regards,

Fr=
ank R.

  ----- Original Message ----
From: Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@ h=
otmail.com>
To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Thursday, November 15, 2007 =
10:17:20 AM
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...

    
 Interesting. I can se=
e the price for early models. This stuff take tons of time to put together.=
 I don't want to fault anyone ---yet. I couldn't figure out how to sell the=
 things, and keep it honest, but all that does is deny everyone from using =
it.
 
 Frank-S

  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
From: warrior18eii@ yahoo.co=
m
Date: Wed, 14 Nov 2007 19:43:51 -0800
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...
=

          $400 to $650 dollars a unit. This guy is retarded! If he is sell=
ing this unit, he doesn't get it Frank!

Frank R.
